title: "Open Directory" in Profile Directory with Flatpak install goes nowhere after new install to Linux (trying to move profile to new laptop) (bug1625111)
content:
Hi,

I'm trying to move Thunderbird from my Windows 10 laptop to one where I just installed Linux (Zorin Pro 17.3). I followed the instructions here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

I installed Thunderbird 140.4.0 esr, which is the latest version. Both laptops now have that version installed.

But when I open TB on the Linux computer, and close the Account Setup window, and go to the Troubleshooting screen, next to "Profile Directory" it says "Open Directory", but when I click on that, nothing happens. So how can I paste my TB profile? Do I have to start a new profile first, and then copy over that?

I installed TB from the "Software" area, which I believe is a Flatpak. I'm very new to Linux, so just fumbling around here. There were 3 options of Thunderbird. I installed the one that had the most information and seemed most up to date. That was confusing.

I would LOVE some help on this.

Thanks!
creator: DD46

title: address re-indexing failed
content:
I am using Windows 10 Enterprise LTSC, Version 21H2, and Mozilla Thunderbird 140.3.1esr (64-Bit)

Suddenly, the number of entries in my address book has shrunk to 259. The size of the file abook.sqlite was 768 kB. Following the advice on https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database, I did Rebuilding the Global Database That did not have an effect on my address book, the lost email addresses did not reappear. What can I do?

Matthias (now to this forum)
creator: matthias76

title: Archives versus Archive
content:
Some time this year Thunderbird started using an Archive folder instead of the existing Archives folder. I have over ten years of archived messages in the Archives folders.

I want to stop the archiving into the Archive folders. I also want to delete the Archive folders but it is not an available option.

creator: rechnung

title: Why so much change?
content:
You keep changing things so much it is getting more a little aggravating to have to dismiss each. Today I had to figure out what was wrong with my login. I still don't know why it was no longer good and set up a new account which seems to be working.

I don't want to have to keep re-learning everything and having to reestablish all my information just be able to check my mail. I continue to get more and spam in my inbox because people trick you online into sigining up for daily posts etc. I especially don't like having to change my password so often because your system wants it. I don't. I just want a program that shows my email, not advertising from every idiot on the internet.

Please, keep the changes to a minimum. I seldom see any great difference from one version to another anyway. Wouldn't it be helpful not to have recreate Thunderbird all over again?

Sincerely Michael Miller
creator: brmichaelofthecross

title: Inbox messages gone
content:
Hello,

A couple of days ago when I opened Thunderbird all of my emails in my Inbox before 18.10. where suddenly gone. All other files in my folders and trash are still there as far as I can tell.

First I thought they were moved but I can't find them anymore, they just vanished.

The inbox file in my profile folder is now 2MB in size, I have a backup from 2 years ago where it was 2,3GB so it must have been even bigger than that.

I believe there was a thunderbird update but it was so fast that I did not even notice at first.

I'm on windows 10 and thunderbird 144.0.1

I'm pretty sure my mails are gone, I was just wondering if anyone is in a similar situation and what could have caused this.

Thanks for any clues.
creator: cl

title: Thunderbird not creating Sent folder on new empty account
content:
Hello,

where should I look as Thunderbird email client does not create the Sent Items folder on server when a new empty mail account is added and a mail is sent.

The sent mail is instead stored on local disk in Sent Items.

On the server side (postfix, dovecot) the mail folder is created under /var/mail/vhosts/domain/user where other items such as inbox is added and incoming mails are stored there. Sent items was just not created.

For comparison I tried the same with Apple Mail client and it added a 'Sent Items' folder under the server path, which if I manually set it in Thunderbird will be used correctly for sent mails.

What could go wrong as the server path /var/mail/vhosts/domain/user is correctly writable and the inbox can be created and also the apple client however creates also the sent items folder.

With some other servers with identical setup I have not had this issue.
creator: soldysoldatova

title: New mails in threads do not show up in bold
content:
Hello,

I use Thunderbird ver 140.4.0esr (64-bit).

I have the problem that when a new mail arrives into a thread I do not see the thread as bolded. Only the oldest (read) mail appears in the list of emails. I have to open the threads to find out that there is an unread mail in the end of it (shown in bold and green dot).

How should I set the appearance so that the latest, unread appears on the top in bold, or that the thread somehow indicates that there is a unread message in it? I general I want the latest emails on the top, but for threads that does not apperar to work.

I have not realised this problem before, so I asuume it is caused by an update.

Mikael

title: Slow sending of Gmail emails
content:
There is a significant delay when sending emails from a Gmail account. Messages consistently take approx. 2 minutes and 15 seconds to be sent. They are always delivered successfully after this delay.

I have triple-checked the settings and tried removing and re-adding the account, as well as clearing caches, but nothing seems to help. It appears to be a handshake issue with Google's SMTP server?!

Is there a way to debug the communication between Thunderbird and the SMTP server to see what exactly is happening during the send process?

title: Deja Dup backups incomplete?
content:
I recently booted up a new installation of Thunderbird on a new laptop running Fedora Linux after my old Laptop running Ubuntu died. Fortunately, I had been regularly backing up the old machine with Deja Dup. I restored all my files from a recent backup. All my files seem to have been successfully recovered except that many locally-stored Thunderbird messages are missing, and some local folder names have been corrupted.

Since I see problems only with Thunderbird, I suspect the problem lies there rather than with Deja Dup.

Has anyone else had problems with restoring Thunderbird from backups? Is there something I might try to recover the missing messages and corrupted folders? Should I be using a different backup in the future?
creator: Mozillist

title: dopo aggiornamento thunderbird ha cambiato in inglese nomi cartelle
content: Buonasera, dopo aver fatto l'ultimo aggiornamento il programma mi ha cambiato in inglese i nomi di tutte le cartelle. Ho verificato e la lingua impostata è ancora l'italiano, non ho altre lingue alternative, ma non riesco né a ripristinare i nomi in italiano né a rinominare le cartelle. Ho provato ad inserire la stringa "user_pref("mail.folder.localizedNames", true);" su "prefs.js", su suggerimento di copilot, ma nulla è cambiato. Per me non è un grande problema, ma siccomee thunderbird lo usa anche mia madre di 91 anni, tutti i giorni e più volte al giorno, mi sta facendo impazzire perché rivuole le cartelle in italiano, ma io non so più cosa fare... Potete aiutarmi, per favore? Grazie e buona serata Giorgio
creator: grg0401
